She continues to strengthen her technical and analytical skills, inspiring young women to explore STEM fields and harness technology to make a positive impact on the world.

name: Ms. Carmen M. Nzamba
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Carmen M_ Nzamba Ambassador of Republic of Gabon.jpg
about: Carmen M. Nzamba is a seasoned global education specialist, entrepreneur and student mentor with over 15 years of experience teaching English in high schools, universities, and business institutions. She founded her own training business in 2021 and actively organizes academic conferences, business events, and webinars for international students and entrepreneurs. Since February 2025, she has served as the G100 France Country Chair for Global Networking. Carmen is also the founder and president of Buy & Promote Africa First (B-PAF) since 2020, and a committed volunteer with “100000 Entrepreneurs.” Her initiatives include launching a virtual company project for high schoolers, creating a “Parents Club” to support study trips, and founding the “Jeunes Ambassadeurs et Leaders d’Afrik” program. With a strong academic background in U.S. foreign policy and diplomacy, she was a visiting researcher in Montreal in 2010 and worked as a media consultant for TV5 and RFI from 2011 to 2012.

name: Ms. Natasha Lumpa
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Natasha Lumpa Zambia Co-Ambassador.jpg
about: Natasha Lumpa is a passionate development practitioner and Project Officer at She Entrepreneur Zambia, where she supports women through business development training, mentorship, and networking. With a diploma in Primary Education and currently pursuing a degree in Development Studies, Natasha combines her background in education with her commitment to community empowerment. She is driven by a vision to create lasting social impact, particularly through women empowerment events, youth leadership seminars, and literacy initiatives.

name: Ms. Charmaine Mangion
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Charmaine Mangion Malta Ambassador.jpg
about: Charmaine Mangion is the Founder and Managing Director of Magic Castle Waldorf Childcare, Malta’s first Steiner Waldorf-inspired childcare centre, launched in 2014. Starting her business at just 21, she identified a need for holistic, screen-free early childhood education. Her enterprise has grown into MC Innovative Ltd, operating a chain of centres. Charmaine has received national recognition, including Company of Excellence and National Young Businesswoman of the Year awards. She also chairs the Consultative Council for Women’s Rights, advocating for gender equality. She holds qualifications in leadership, business, and early education, and is currently pursuing an LL.B. at the University of Malta.

name: Ms. Wanjiku Chebet Kanjumba
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Wanjiku Chebet Kanjumba Kenya Ambassador.jpg
about: Wanjiku Chebet Kanjumba is a Kenyan aerospace engineer, futurist, and space advocate dedicated to advancing humanity’s presence in space. She holds Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Aerospace Engineering, with a minor in Space Operations, and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering. Wanjiku works on projects like the Omega Spaceport, aimed at expanding space access for Africa, Asia, and Oceania. She has contributed to NASA and ESA initiatives and trained as a PoSSUM Scientist-Astronaut. Selected as a Titans Space R&D Astronaut-Candidate, Wanjiku is passionate about STEM outreach and inspiring the next generation of space explorers.

name: Ms. Devica Kamini Uditram
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Devica Kamini Uditram Guyana Ambassador.jpg
about: Ms. Devica Kamini Uditram is a finance professional with over a decade of experience in banking and public service, currently serving as an Economic and Financial Analyst at Guyana’s Ministry of Finance. She tutors at Green State Technical University and is pursuing postgraduate studies in Strategic Development Studies. Passionate about community service, Devica has led literacy, health, and mental health initiatives benefiting thousands across Guyana. She is the founder of The Literary Coven GY Book Club and a mentor for Youth Parliament. Her contributions have earned her a National Youth Award, 25 Influential Women Leaders Award, and 30 under 30 Changemaker Award.

name: Ms. Jessica Golding
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Jessica Golding Jamaica Co-Ambassador.jpg
about: Jessica Golding is a passionate teacher dedicated to empowering students to reach their full potential. She is currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree at Moneague College, where her academic journey has fueled her growth and commitment to education. Deeply invested in the development of girls, Jessica actively participates in initiatives that promote empowerment and equality. As a proud recipient of the prestigious Doreen Clemtson Scholarship, she honors the legacy of service and leadership within Girl Guides Jamaica. Residing in Victoria District, Linstead, St. Catherine, Jessica continues to inspire through her work, embodying the values of compassion, leadership, and community service.

name: Ms. Nongbzanga Ariane Fabiola Ouedraogo
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Nongbzanga Ariane Fabiola Ouedraogo Ambassador Poster.jpg
about: Nongbzanga Ariane Fabiola Ouedraogo is a Computer Science major with a Mathematics minor in the United States. She is the President and Founder of Duni Paale and Women in Science and Technology (WISAT), organizations dedicated to empowering youth, advancing women in STEM, and fostering leadership. A passionate STEM advocate, she is committed to service, helping vulnerable communities, and inspiring the next generation to harness science and technology for positive change.

name: Ms. Ketra Polydore
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ KETRA POLYDORE Dominica Ambassador - Mission ShakthiSAT.jpg
about: Ketra Polydore is a results-oriented professional with over 6 years of experience in legal administration, project management, and customer support, specializing in law firm operations, including Companies, Intellectual Property, and Citizenship by Investment processes. She consistently delivers high-quality client services while efficiently managing documentation and compliance within legal frameworks. As a Senior Clerk, Ketra is adept at coordinating teams, streamlining workflows, and ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of critical legal filings. Her strong leadership, honed through Agile Project Management, combined with her proficiency in SQL and Strategic Management, allows her to integrate technology and business strategies to enhance operational efficiency. Beyond her professional expertise, Ketra is an active community leader and athlete. She organizes monthly sports tournaments in her local community, handling logistics and participant engagement, contributing to both community building and club growth. As an elected Counselor for the Pointe Michel Village Council, she plays an active role in improving residents' quality of life. Ketra is also a proud member of JCI Dominica, demonstrating her commitment to leadership, community service, and continuous development.

name: Ms. Fiorella Arias-Bonilla
image: /img/Ambassadors/Fiorella Arias-Bonilla - Costa Rica Co-Ambassador.jpg
about: Fiorella Arias Bonilla is a Biotechnology Engineer from Costa Rica with experience in agricultural biotechnology, science diplomacy, and space sciences. As a Visiting Scholar at UC Davis, she researched functionalized hydrogels for Bioregenerative Life Support Systems and earned recognition for her thesis on sustainable agricultural systems for space habitats. She co-founded Orbital Space Technologies and ACACIE and has been honored as an Emerging Space Leader, Global Rising Star, LATAM Biotech Leader, and Forbes 30 Under 30 Central America awardee. A winner of the 2025 Space Station Design Workshop, she is dedicated to sustainability, rural development, BLiSS, mental health, and women’s rights.

name: Ms. Daniela Jovic
image: /img/Ambassadors/Ms_ Daniela Jovic Ambassador Croatia.jpg
about: Daniela Jovic is a space industry consultant, public speaker, and the founder of ORBITALYX, a company supporting satellite missions, business development, and communications across the NewSpace sector. She has led multiple satellite projects, including Croatia’s first satellite, CroCube, and collaborates with institutions, companies, and events across Europe and beyond. Her work spans mission coordination, launch strategy, brand positioning, and public engagement. Through every role, Daniela actively promotes visibility, inclusion, and access to space for emerging professionals and underrepresented communities, with a strong focus on education, storytelling, and cross-sector collaboration.
